title: Data Visualization
text:
Visuals that clarify results and support decisions.
Overview: We craft static and interactive visuals that meet scientific standards and drive action.
We can help you with:

 Static & interactive data visualizations ‚Äî Purposeful charts and dashboards for insight and storytelling.

 Geospatial & cartographic visualization ‚Äî Map design, tiled maps, choropleths and spatial analysis to reveal geographic patterns and spatial relationships.

 Graphical review of scientific figures ‚Äî Improve clarity, reproducibility and journal readiness.

 Shiny dashboards & exploration interfaces ‚Äî Interactive tools for probing data and exporting results.

 Client‚Äëfacing clinical reports ‚Äî Concise, action‚Äëoriented deliverables.



Benefits: Clearer insight, better stakeholder buy‚Äëin and publishable visual outputs.

title: We Data
text:
Short talks or multi-day courses on dataviz, R, ggplot2, data analytics and more.

We have a passion for teaching and have conducted numerous workshops and training sessions on various topics related to data science and analytics.
We can help you with:

 Conducting short talks or multi-day courses on data visualization, R programming, ggplot2, reproducible research, bayesian statistics, and data analytics.
 Providing customized training sessions tailored to your specific needs and objectives.





‚Äì  We delivered a series of short talks on data visualization techniques for undergraduate students, covering fundamental principles and practical tips for creating effective visualizations.
‚Äì  We taught a multi-day course on R programming for beginners, covering topics such as data manipulation, visualization, and basic statistical analysis.
‚Äì  We organized and facilitated a workshop on ggplot2, a popular data visualization package in R, demonstrating how to create customized plots and advanced visualizations.
‚Äì  We provided training sessions on data analytics tools and techniques to professionals in the industry, helping them develop skills in data exploration, modeling, and interpretation.
‚Äì  Additionally, we have contributed to educational materials, such as this repository, where we share resources and tutorials for learning data science concepts and tools.
‚Äì  We have also been guests on several podcasts, discussing topics related to data science, analytics, and visualization.




Tell us more about your training needs at david.munoztord@mailbox.org to see if we can work together.

title: Research & Analytics Consulting
text:
From research question to deployable, auditable results.
Overview: We partner on applied research and analytics mandates with an emphasis on reproducibility, uncertainty quantification and operationalisation.
We can help you with:

 Demography (description ¬∑ prediction ¬∑ simulation) ‚Äî Population models and scenario analysis for planning and policy.

 Public policy analysis ‚Äî Evidence synthesis and impact assessments that inform decisions.

 Social network analysis ‚Äî Network construction, community detection and interpretation.

 Bayesian modelling & statistical inference ‚Äî Transparent probabilistic models and clear uncertainty communication.

 Reproducible analysis pipelines ‚Äî End‚Äëto‚Äëend workflows from raw data to report with versioning and provenance.

 Fraud, risk, behaviour, demand and operations modelling ‚Äî Predictive and diagnostic models tuned to operational constraints.



Benefits: Reusable, auditable outputs, clear assumptions and smooth handover to operational teams.

title: Innovation Projects
text:
Long‚Äëterm R&D and research software to de‚Äërisk future choices.
Overview: We lead prototypes and research software projects that explore new language features, frameworks and tooling.
We can help you with:

 TypR ‚Äî Typed R concepts to improve reliability and developer ergonomics.

 Relm ‚Äî MVU‚Äëbased web framework for R for reproducible frontends.

 Long‚Äëterm research software & prototypes ‚Äî Proofs‚Äëof‚Äëconcept and transition plans to production.



Benefits: Early validation of technical choices and clearer roadmaps for long‚Äëterm development.

title: Software Development & Engineering
text:
Prototypes to production systems that serve users and teams reliably.
Overview: We design and implement software‚Äîfrom early prototypes to hardened services‚Äîbalancing rapid delivery with engineering discipline.
We can help you with:

 R packages & Shiny applications ‚Äî Reusable code, tests and production‚Äëgrade analytics UIs.

 Full‚Äëstack data applications (servers, DB layers, Shiny server admin) ‚Äî End‚Äëto‚Äëend app delivery.

 MLOps (R, Python, Julia) ‚Äî Training, validation, serving and monitoring pipelines.

 CI/CD pipelines & deployment support ‚Äî Automated testing and safe delivery practices.

 Self‚Äëhosting infrastructure & deployment environments ‚Äî Hardened hosting for private or regulated needs.



Benefits: Faster time to production, clearer maintenance ownership and predictable operations.

title: We Data
text:
Creation of static and interactive dataviz, review of scientific figures.

We are experts in the field of dataviz. We‚Äôve created several tutorials and given talks on this topic.
We can help you with:

 Creation and review of graphs for scientific publication.
 Development of data application using R and Shiny.
 Creation of custom data visualization for the web.
 Dashboard creation for real time data analysis.
 Visualization of geospatial data.





‚Äì  We maintain and develop echarts4r, a declarative framework for rapid construction of Web-based data visualization.
‚Äì  We reviewed and improved scientific figures for research publications, ensuring clarity and accuracy in data representation.
‚Äì  We conducted several workshops on data visualization techniques, covering topics such as chart types, color theory, and storytelling with data.




If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about how we can assist with your project, feel free to reach out at david.munoztord@mailbox.org.

title: Contact & Engagement
text:
Start with a brief ‚Äî we‚Äôll reply with a concise proposal.
Overview: We offer workshops, short projects and retained advisory. Engagements are scoped to outcomes, timelines and available capacity.
We can help you with:

 How to start ‚Äî Send a short brief with objectives, audience, timeline and constraints.

 Preferred delivery format ‚Äî Tell us the preferred delivery format (workshop, pilot project, retainer).

 Compliance & constraints ‚Äî Share any compliance or data constraints up front.



What we deliver in response:

 Concise proposal ‚Äî Scope, deliverables, timeline and budget estimate.
 Suggested next steps ‚Äî Available dates and follow-up options.

For urgent requests, include preferred dates and we will propose a compressed timeline if capacity allows.

Expandable items: - Open‚Äësource contributions & maintainership (rOpenSci, Opifex) ‚Äî Improve tools researchers rely on. - We Data (co‚Äëfounder), R‚ÄëLunch meetups and workshops ‚Äî Events that build skills and networks. - Blog posts, YouTube tutorials and reproducible examples ‚Äî Resources that accelerate adoption. - Partnerships (UN Geneva ‚ÄúAI for Good‚Äù Hub and others) ‚Äî Collaborative projects with institutional impact.
Benefits: Shared knowledge, better tools and broader community adoption.

title: Data Engineering
text:
Turn messy sources into dependable, model‚Äëready data.
Overview: We implement ingestion, transformation and storage that make data trustworthy and accessible for analytics and ML.
We can help you with:

 Data harvesting & ingestion ‚Äî Stable connectors, scheduling and change capture.

 ETL/ELT pipeline design & orchestration ‚Äî Maintainable transformations with lineage and observability.

 Database storage & schema design ‚Äî Scalable schemas and indexing tuned for analytics.

 Data management & governance ‚Äî Cataloguing, access controls and documentation to reduce technical debt.






 Built ingestion pipelines for multi-source datasets and implemented versioned storage for reproducible analysis.
 Designed ETL/ELT orchestration and monitoring for large-scale analytics workloads.

title: We Data
text:
A data project always start with a data engineering step. You need to harvest data and store it in an adequate format to be able to use it. Let us help you with it!
We can help you with:

 Harvest data from various sources, including APIs, SQL databases, or complex Excel spreadsheets.
 Reformat and reshape data to facilitate further analysis.
 Clean datasets to remove outliers and aberrant data points.
 Develop reproducible data preparation workflows.
 Automate the creation of data-related reports.






 Led development and launch of a collaborative project with EPFL, transitioning scripts into a Software as a Service (SaaS) solution on AWS.
 Provided technical consulting to a startup, translating academic research into actionable solutions and advising on machine learning.
 Collaborated across departments to design and deploy data platform initiatives, implementing automation for time savings.





If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about how we can assist with your project, feel free to reach out at david.munoztord@mailbox.org.

title: Services
text:
We help teams and organisations turn data, code and analytics into reliable products and clear decisions. Our services combine training, applied research, engineering, data‚Äëops, visualization, security and longer‚Äëterm innovation ‚Äî available as focused workshops, multi‚Äëweek projects, or retained advisory.

Below are our practice areas ‚Äî click any card to learn more about what we deliver and the benefits you can expect.

title: We Data
text:
Data exploration, application of statistical methods, reproducible data analysis.
 Crunch the data to get answers to your questions. Give insight to the information.
We can help you with:

 Exploratory analysis of a dataset.
 Creation of clean and reproducible reports using Rmardown and Shiny.
 Application of statistical methods on your dataset.
 Creation of custom scripts for analyzing/ingesting your data automatically





‚Äì  We are the authors of several scientific publications where we were in charge to explore and understand complex datasets in order to answer scientific questions.
‚Äì  We built machine learning pipelines to implement predictive models to detect fraud in clients behavior and analyze it.
‚Äì  Designed and implemented Apache NiFi ETL for efficient data processing and orchestration, contributing to streamlined data workflows.




If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about how we can assist with your project, feel free to reach out at david.munoztord@mailbox.org.

title: Code Quality, Security & Deployment
text:
Audit, harden and ship with confidence.
Overview: We audit codebases and deployment pipelines to lower risk, improve maintainability and accelerate delivery.
We can help you with:

 Code review (Rust, R, Python, JavaScript) ‚Äî Practical recommendations for tests, clarity and performance.

 Pentesting of web applications ‚Äî Identify and prioritise security issues and remediation steps.

 CI/CD integration & production deployment support ‚Äî Hardened pipelines, monitoring and runbooks.

 Governance & secure delivery standards ‚Äî Policies, versioning and controls tailored to your needs.



Benefits: Fewer incidents, faster recovery and stronger compliance.

title: Training & Education
text:
Role‚Äëtailored workshops and learning paths for immediate impact.
Overview: We design hands‚Äëon courses that take participants from concept to applied practice. Each session is tailored to role, domain and desired outcomes.
We can help you with:

 R (intro ¬∑ data science ¬∑ computational social sciences) ‚Äî Idiomatic R, reproducible pipelines and packaging so teams produce robust, shareable results.

 Python (intro ¬∑ analytics ¬∑ computational sciences) ‚Äî Practical modules on data manipulation, numerical computing and reproducible workflows.

 Bash & Git ‚Äî Command‚Äëline proficiency and branching/CI practices to reduce collaboration friction.

 Quarto & Typst ‚Äî Reproducible authoring and technical document generation for papers and reports.

 Cloud fundamentals (Azure), Docker & CI/CD ‚Äî Essentials for deploying reliable services.



Benefits: Short learning curves, ready‚Äëto‚Äëuse materials, and measurable improvements in team output.

title: We Data
text:
About us

We are an independent association dedicated to sharing our passion for data science and computer science, with a strong focus on statistics and computational methods. While our initial audience was people in the social sciences, we have since expanded our reach to various research fields and professional communities.

 Concretely, the association pursues its goals by creating freely accessible educational content on multiple platforms, including YouTube videos, blog posts, exercises, and more. We also organize and offer consulting services, workshops, and talks to help individuals and organizations enhance their skills in data analysis and programming. Additionally, the association hosts regular events and presentations on relevant topics, aiming to foster knowledge sharing and community engagement in the digital and data science spheres 


Still curious? click ‚ÄòAbout‚Äô above or this button here: Tell me more  ##### Quick line

We turn data into decisions ‚Äî training, research and engineering for teams who need trustworthy results.

title: Community & Open‚ÄëSource
text:
Community & Open‚ÄëSource
 Contributing and organising to amplify impact. We contribute to open tooling, run community events and produce public learning materials that make good practices accessible.
We can help you with:

 Open‚Äësource contributions & maintainership (rOpenSci, Opifex) ‚Äî Package review, maintenance and community support to improve tools researchers rely on.

 We Data (co‚Äëfounder), R‚ÄëLunch meetups and workshops ‚Äî Community-building events that share practical skills, create networks and foster collaboration.

 Blog posts, YouTube tutorials and reproducible examples ‚Äî Public learning materials and demos that accelerate adoption of best practices and reproducible workflows.

 Partnerships (UN Geneva ‚ÄúAI for Good‚Äù Hub and others) ‚Äî Collaborative projects with institutional partners to deliver research and policy impact.




Examples:

 Led package review and maintenance contributions to rOpenSci-backed packages, improving tests and documentation.
 Organised and delivered R‚ÄëLunch sessions and hands-on workshops focused on reproducible workflows.
 Produced tutorials and reproducible examples published on the blog and YouTube that demonstrate real-world workflows.




Contact
If you‚Äôd like to collaborate or learn more, reach out at david.munoztord@mailbox.org.
